units.title: Pooling PSC lines before organoid generation
units.text: we pooled PSC lines (5,000 cells per line) before organoid generation
units.rationale: Establishes the initial multiplexing step by combining cells from multiple donors.

units.title: Longitudinal proliferation assessment via flow cytometry
units.text: we longitudinally assessed the proliferation rate of organoids derived from individual lines in two differentiation replicates through flow cytometry-based cell cycle analysis
units.rationale: Measures growth dynamics across time points to monitor developmental consistency.

units.title: Immunofluorescence characterization of mCBOs
units.text: we first characterized mCBOs by immunofluorescence for canonical markers of neurodevelopment previously defined for organoids
units.rationale: Validates organoid identity and developmental stage before downstream analyses.

units.title: Generation of mosaic CBOs with equal cell numbers
units.text: we pooled PSC lines (5,000 cells per line) before organoid generation we benchmarked them with ground truth priors using (1) five in silico multiplexed datasets with varying degree of balance among genotypes and (2) two ad hoc experiments in which the different genotypes were barcode-tagged before pooling
units.rationale: Creates mosaic organoids while controlling for cell input to enable fair comparison of genotypes.

units.title: Single‑cell dissociation and library preparation
units.text: CBOs were generated individually from the PSC lines and ... after organoid dissociation for single-cell library preparation
units.rationale: Prepares single‑cell suspensions for scRNA‑seq, preserving individual line identities.

units.title: Demultiplexing using SCanSNP and consensus call
units.text: we set a consensus call framework merging their outcomes into one combined output (Fig. 3b)
units.rationale: Integrates multiple demultiplexing tools to improve genotype assignment accuracy.

units.title: Benchmarking demultiplexing algorithms with in silico and experimental datasets
units.text: we assessed the demultiplexing performance of the different algorithms, we pooled PSC lines (5,000 cells per line) before organoid generation we benchmarked them with ground truth priors using (1) five in silico multiplexed datasets with varying degree of balance among genotypes and (2) two ad hoc experiments in which the different genotypes were barcode-tagged before pooling
units.rationale: Evaluates tool reliability across simulated and real multiplexed data.

units.title: Re‑demultiplexing after initial analysis
units.text: Next, we performed demultiplexing again using all the above demultiplexing algorithms
units.rationale: Ensures consistency of cell identity calls by re‑applying multiple methods.

units.title: Assessment of doublet detection bias
units.text: we observed a high number of pre‑directed doublets with an unexpected read count distribution skewed low values when compared to singlets (Extended Data Fig. 3a,b)
units.rationale: Identifies potential artifacts that could confound downstream single‑cell analyses.

units.title: Evaluation of genotype balance across multiplexed datasets
units.text: we observed that doublet detection agree before single-cell droplet encapsulation (hereafter referred to as downstream multiplexing) (Fig. 1a and the Methods)
units.rationale: Checks that genotype representation remains even throughout the multiplexing workflow.
